00001 /*
00002  *  maven Programming Language
00003  *  Created by Elliot Chance <elliot@chancemedia.com>.
00004  */
00005 
00006 #include "maven.h"
00007 #include "struct_StringList.h"
00008 #include "struct_MavenCompiler.h"
00009 #include "strings.h"
00010 #include "objects.h"
00011 #include "errors.h"
00012 #include "namespaces.h"
00013 
00014 // bug #43: is this being used anymore?
00015 string findVariablePath(MavenCompiler* c, string entity, int& namespaceID, int& objectID, int& variableID) {
00016         // the difficulty with this is that the number of dots doesnt indicate which part (if any)
00017         // is the namespace, class, variable and subvariables. So the way we do it is to try the first
00018         // part as a namespace, then try it as a class etc
00019         
00020         // split on the dot
00021         StringList parts = split('.', entity);
00022         if(parts.length() == 0) return "";
00023         namespaceID = -1;
00024         objectID = -1;
00025         variableID = -1;
00026         
00027         // 1. is the first part a namespace?
00028         for(int i = 0; i < c->namespaces->length(); ++i) {
00029                 if(c->namespaces->at(i).name == parts[0]) {
00030                         
00031                         // now look for the class
00032                         bool foundClass = false;
00033                         for(int j = 0; j < c->namespaces->at(i).objects->length(); ++j) {
00034                                 if(c->namespaces->at(i).objects->at(j)->name == parts[1]) {
00035                                         foundClass = true;
00036                                         
00037                                         // now look for the variable
00038                                         for(int k = 0; k < c->namespaces->at(i).objects->at(j)->variables->length(); ++k) {
00039                                                 if(c->namespaces->at(i).objects->at(j)->variables->at(k).name == parts[2]) {
00040                                                         namespaceID = i;
00041                                                         objectID = j;
00042                                                         variableID = k;
00043                                                         string r = c->namespaces->at(i).name + "::" + c->namespaces->at(i).objects->at(j)->name;
00044                                                         if(c->namespaces->at(i).objects->at(j)->variables->at(k).isStatic)
00045                                                                 r += "$static";
00046                                                         r += string("::") + c->namespaces->at(i).objects->at(j)->variables->at(k).name;
00047                                                         return r;
00048                                                 }
00049                                         }
00050                                         
00051                                         pushError(c, "%s does not have the member variable %s", parts[0] + "." + parts[1], parts[2]);
00052                                         return MAVEN_INVALID;
00053                                 }
00054                         }
00055                         if(!foundClass) {
00056                                 pushError(c, "class '%s' does not belong to namespace '%s'", parts[1], parts[0]);
00057                                 return MAVEN_INVALID;
00058                         }
00059                 }
00060         }
00061         
00062         // 2. now test as a class name, making sure it's not ambiguous
00063         vector<int> ambig;
00064         for(int i = 0; i < c->namespaces->length(); ++i)
00065                 for(int j = 0; j < c->namespaces->at(i).objects->length(); ++j)
00066                         if(c->namespaces->at(i).objects->at(j)->name == parts[0])
00067                                 ambig.push_back(i);
00068                                 
00069         if(ambig.size() == 1) {
00070                 return findVariablePath(c, c->namespaces->at(ambig[0]).name + "." + entity, namespaceID, objectID, variableID);
00071         } else if(ambig.size() > 1) {
00072                 string belong = "";
00073                 for(int i = 0; i < ambig.size(); ++i) {
00074                         if(belong != "") belong += ", ";
00075                         belong += c->namespaces->at(ambig[i]).name;
00076                 }
00077                 pushError(c, "%s is ambiguous, belonging to %s", parts[0], belong);
00078         }
00079         
00080         // 3. now look through all bare classes
00081         for(int i = 0; i < c->namespaces->length(); ++i)
00082                 for(int j = 0; j < c->namespaces->at(i).objects->at(0)->variables->length(); ++j)
00083                         if(c->namespaces->at(i).objects->at(0)->variables->at(j).name == parts[0])
00084                                 ambig.push_back(i);
00085         
00086         if(ambig.size() == 1) {
00087                 return findVariablePath(c, c->namespaces->at(ambig[0]).name + ".nil." + entity, namespaceID, objectID, variableID);
00088         } else if(ambig.size() > 1) {
00089                 string belong = "";
00090                 for(int i = 0; i < ambig.size(); ++i) {
00091                         if(belong != "") belong += ", ";
00092                         belong += c->namespaces->at(ambig[i]).name;
00093                 }
00094                 pushError(c, "%s is ambiguous, belonging to %s", parts[0], belong);
00095         }
00096         
00097         // 4. now we look in the localScope
00098         string path = "";
00099         for(int i = 0; i < c->localScope.size(); ++i) {
00100                 for(int j = 0; j < c->localScope[i].length(); ++j) {
00101                         if(c->localScope[i][j].name == parts[0]) {
00102                                 variableID = MAVEN_LOCALSCOPE;
00103                                 return c->localScope[i][j].name;
00104                         }
00105                 }
00106         }
00107         
00108         // 5. it may be the current class (or even inherited)
00109         namespaceID = findNamespaceID(c, c->currentNamespace);
00110         objectID = findObjectID(c, namespaceID, c->currentClass);
00111         if(namespaceID >= 0 && objectID >= 0) {
00112                 for(int i = 0; i < c->namespaces->at(namespaceID).objects->at(objectID)->variables->length(); ++i) {
00113                         if(c->namespaces->at(namespaceID).objects->at(objectID)->variables->at(i).name == parts[0]) {
00114                                 variableID = i;
00115                                 return parts[0];
00116                         }
00117                 }
00118         }
00119         
00120         return MAVEN_INVALID;
00121 }
